intro: Turbinicarpus klinkerianus, commonly known as the Klinkerian turbinated cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Mexican state of San Luis Potosí. It is characterized by its globular, ribbed stem that is often covered in a dense layer of white, powdery bloom, which helps to reduce water loss. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking visual contrast to its otherwise desolate appearance. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated by succulent enthusiasts.
